author: Pon Vasanth Arunachalam
text:
Members of the lawyers’ wing of DMK submitted a petition at the Collectorate on Saturday alleging that the photos of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa were yet to be removed from many government offices in Madurai.

M.A. Palanichamy, State vice-president of the wing, said that the pictures had not been removed despite the Model Code of Conduct for Assembly elections came into force more than a week ago. “This is a clear case of violation and we demand a swift action,” he said.

“We cited a particular instance at the Government Pleader’s office in Madurai Bench of Madras High Court where the picture had not been removed,” he added.

They submitted the petition to G. Senthilkumari, Revenue Divisional Officer, Madurai, who assured to look into the issue immediately.
title: DMK lawyers’ wing files complaint
